articles.description: England manager Sarina Wiegman has now led the home nation to the title in back-to-back women's Euros.
articles.content:
England won a major womens tournament for the first time as Chloe Kellys extra-time goal secured a 2-1 victory over Germany at a sold-out Wembley on Sunday.
In front of a record crowd of 87,192 for … [+3779 chars]

articles.description: The 37-year-old appeared for 45 minutes in the 1-1 draw against Spanish team Rayo Vallecano in a friendly match at Old Trafford.

articles.title: Five things we learned about South Africa from their series win over England - ESPNcricinfo
articles.description: With the T20 World Cup looming, the performances of Hendricks, Stubbs, Ngidi and others have made the selectors' job exceedingly tricky
